content.description: The diagram above represents the photoelectric effect for a metal. When the metal surface is exposed to light with increasing frequency and energy of photons, electrons first begin to be ejected from the metal when the energy of the photons is <math alttext="3.3 times 10 to the power negative 19, Joule" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Which of the following is closest to the frequency of the light with photon energy of <math alttext="3.3 times 10 to the power negative 19, Joule" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="5.0 times 10 to the power negative 53, per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>53</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="5.0 times 10 to the power negative 16, per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>16</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="5.0 times 10 to the power 14, per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="5.0 times 10 to the power 52, per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>52</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="5.0 times 10 to the power 14, per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
